storyInfo: The Doctor and co. accept Enciodes's invitation to Kjerag. After a short recuperation on all fronts, they board the train for Mt. Karlan.

attributes.text: A minute touch of force from outside. With just the lightest push...
An avalanche will bury the whole of Kjerag, conspiracies, machinations and all.

attributes.content: Sir, this is just a shoddy plank of wood. What makes it sell for fifty whole pounds?
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Now, sir, you'll want to learn something new today. This is no ordinary piece of wood. It's a blessing of Kjeragandr, Goddess of the Snow Realm.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: It's all thanks to Her protection that Kjerag could be free from the Catastrophes and set down roots here.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: And the stuff that made this charm comes from the evergreen trees of Mount Jungfrau, our own second-highest peak in all of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Do you know much about Jungfrau? Legends say, it's a mountain formed from the tears of Kjeragandr as they fell and froze.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: The trees watered in that snow from on high grow full with Kjeragandr's love and favor for this land, and charms made from that timber assure your safety and warding of calamity where you may go.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Seeing as it's your first time here in Kjerag, why not take some souvenirs for your homefolk back in Victoria?
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: What gives you that idea?
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Listen, these last two years, Mr. Enciodes has had more and more of these big corporate whosits flocking in. I heard your accent and I knew straight away.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: To new people like you, see, I recommend these charms in particular to mark the occasion.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Heard of the Tschäggättä, maybe? They're people-eating beasts deep in our mountains. Sinister to the eye, inhuman, there and gone again when you least expect.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: But so long as you're wearing this charm, blessed by the Vine-Bear Court, you'll cower those things under Kjeragandr's might, and they won't harm you.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: And just think, you take it back to your family and tell them, this charm bears the divine protection of Kjerag's Mount Karlan. Paints the complete picture, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: You've tripped halfway across the land to Kjerag. You wouldn't go back to your own without something nice for it, would you?
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: ...Bah, fine. I'll take one, and one for my wife and little tot each!
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: That's the ticket! If only we could all be straightforward as you!
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Let me see—sorry, this wood must've been stripped from any random mountain tree.
Wh—What gives you the right to say that?!
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: First, without approval from the Paleroches, no one's even allowed to climb Jungfrau.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Second, I sure didn't hear about anyone climbing her while I was gone.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: When I left Kjerag, I even told Weiss, if anyone makes it up her, be sure to send me a message.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: How do you know who...
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Wait a minute, that tail... you can't be Miss Ensia?!
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Ensia... y—you're Mr. Enciodes's sister?!
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Uh-huh?
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Now, hold it, sir, were you actually trying to swindle me?!
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Well, hahahah, they said Miss Ensia loved climbing ever since she was little. Seems she knows more about the snowcaps than us commoners after all.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: All these wares of mine came from the hunters in the mountains, actually. They must have been the ones swindling me, no doubt.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: I'll be going to find them and settle our score!
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: As for this charm... Miss Ensia, would you mind?
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: It's true it has the Vine-Bear Court's blessing. No man of Kjerag would dare to forge that seal and offend Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: If you want to ward off any rumored Tschäggättäs with it, forget it. But if you take it back as a souvenir, I think it'll work great.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: So, just slash that price a little.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Huff... in light of that, I'll put them at ten pounds a piece! Now, sir, are you still buying?
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: If the sister of Mr. Enciodes says as much, I've got no reason to be skeptical.
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Business for you must be tough. I'll take five of them!
attributes.name: Business-Tripping Manager

attributes.content: Coming right up.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: Are you here to buy anything, Miss Ensia? Whatever you fancy, it's yours. My business owes itself to the Silverashes, after all.
attributes.name: Kjerag Merchant

attributes.content: No, no, I'll pay you like normal.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Right, Doctor?
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.options: Of course.;Lucky we prepared enough Victorian and Kazimierz cash.;You couldn't just take stuff? It's your clan's territory.

attributes.content: Jeez, we could exchange all we want, but it's still only worth anything in our family's region.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: And this trade port's doing the hottest business anywhere in our land. You may as well spend all that money right here. You'll still get away with it.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Hey, c'mon, Doctor. Other people have to make a living too.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: But if you really want, we can go see what my brother says about it. He'd get things sorted out sweet!
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Lady Ensia, we should be on our way to the station by now.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Ooh, we're tight on time. Doctor, let's go.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: The blizzard is coming. Take caution, outsider.
If you don't want to freeze, leaving now will still save your skin.
What are you blanking for, Doctor?
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Huh? There's nobody here, though.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: It's far from the right season for leisurely outdoor coffee.
You look behind you, and only see the bright canopy blocking the sun, and a sign advertising Karlan Trade.
A deserted terrace sits silent, just like the distant peaks of pure white.
Maybe it was the pages of the magazine on the table, rustling in the wind, that gave you the illusion someone was sitting next to you, talking to you.
Doctor, snap out of it. Let's move.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: We'll meet again.
Matterhorn! You're here. The Master's waiting for you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Good to see you, Weiss.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Aren't you going?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: I was going to, but the Master wants to invite the Doctor to the Tri-Clan Council with him, and have me stay back to greet them in your place. After all, I'm an employee of Rhodes Island myself.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I think you must be ready for a vacation after guarding the Young Lady for so long.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Besides, given you're out here, I'm guessing she ditched you?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Haha, yes. She's shopping with the Doctor right now.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: She wanted a vacation for me too, so she had me let her free.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: That's the Master and the Young Lady for you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Well? How do you feel, being back this time?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The territory's been fast with construction, and huge in its overall change. It's almost unrecognizable already. That's the Master for you, indeed.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: I'll take the two of them up on their great kindness and visit home for now, see my parents, and then I'll be on standby at the Master's.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: How about you?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You've been away for a while too. Last time we met, weren't you off with the Master to Columbia?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: I've got nothing pressing. Savoring the streets again is more than enough for me.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What about that old Itra friend of yours? Monch, I think, was the name. Eat a bite with him if you have the time.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: ...We'll see, I guess.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: It's me.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Can you hear me?
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: I can hear you.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Brilliant! It looks like the base station's signal is fine.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: How are you?
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: I've found a few suitable hidden spots for the comms station installation. But no matter where we install a station in Turicum, we won't be able to catch all of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: This is Kjerag's southern gateway, and practically its only contact channel with the outside.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Setting up a comms network here has massive importance, but if you want to cover the whole of Kjerag, setting up a few more simple stations around the central lake region would be the best option.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: That's not what I'm asking.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: ...? Didn't you have me wandering outside so I could scope things for us?
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: What I mean is, you haven't been back in Kjerag for a long time. How do you feel?
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Honestly, it feels totally unbelievable. When I left Kjerag under the Silverashes' talent fostering program, it was from here too.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Back then, even Turicum was just an ordinary little village, let alone the rail station at the border now.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: I never thought it'd become so big. At this point, I think you could argue it stands up to the cities on the outside.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Doing construction work like this in the snowy mountains must be harder than I could ever imagine.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Where are you all right now, Captain? I'll come find you.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: We're boarding a train to Karlan.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: You don't need to come with yet.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: You mentioned your home was in an industrial area, in the mountains.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Yep.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: For now, go back and visit.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Nothing's more important than family.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: You're back in the mountains. It's the perfect opportunity to head for home. The Doctor thinks so, too.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Did the Doctor say that?
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: ...I understand. If you're okay with it, then I will.
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: So, the Doctor...
attributes.name: Aurora

attributes.content: The Doctor has me with.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: The train for the foot of Mt. Karlan is about to depart.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: The train will depart soon, please board now.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: I'm heading out.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: Have a good break, Aurora.
attributes.name: Sharp

attributes.content: With a steam whistle and a faint announcement, the train departing for Karlan sets slowly into motion.
Doctor, let me tell you about the names of all these peaks.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Look. The one there with the flat-ish slope is Jungfrau. The third Saintess named that one.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: The really steep one there, that's Matterhorn. His name actually came straight from that one.
attributes.name: Ensia

attributes.content: Ensia continues on, with something to say about all the scenery that passes by, and all that Kjerag is.
Aside, Courier wears his eternal smile, listening to every word quietly and respectfully. But from time to time, the faraway look in his eyes carries a hint of something unclear.
Sharp reclines against the seat browsing net pages. He'll find that the contents of Kjerag's internet far exceed his expectations.
Alternately, you listen to Ensia, and cast your gaze out of the window.
Outside, remnants of ice drift in a lake reflecting the blue sky. Some locals are together at its shallows, some drawing water, some doing their laundry, some laughing.
The purest white snowpeaks stand imposingly tall, any attempt to lift your head and see their end blocked by the sunlight.

Halfway up, where the mountains level somewhat, a young shepherd herds flocks of stockbeasts home. No surprise crosses him as he sees the people aboard the train; instead, he lifts his whip, waving at you in greeting.
Not far away is the village where he lives, smoke spiraling from chimneys, peaceful and prosperous.
The sight of it all wipes the cares from your mind.
Perhaps, this journey will be just fine.
